etymology.interpretation: Originally a sketch of a tuft of hair or a feather, with strokes suggesting individual strands. The modern form is a streamlined version that still conveys the idea of fine hair or down.

examples.chinese: 他头上有很多细毛(他頭上有很多細毛)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tóu shàng yǒu hěn duō xì máo.
examples.english: He has a lot of fine hair on his head.

examples.chinese: 猫的毛很软(貓的毛很軟)。
examples.english: A cat’s fur is very soft.

examples.chinese: 他连一根毛也没动(他連一根毛也沒動)。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián yì gēn máo yě méi dòng.
examples.english: He didn’t move a single hair.
